result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Robert Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs within 60 days or set up payment plan with COC office

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Robert Johnson

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

11:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Robert Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared by video for Michael Robert Johnson. 
Court questions defendant who has no objection to appearing by Zoom today.  Atty Juech states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to charge.  Atty Babiak agrees.
Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant on his waiver and finds it is being made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  
State will be filing the Information with the same charge. Atty Babiak received the Information and waives it's reading.  Enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge. Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1.  Court questions Atty Babiak.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently. Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis. BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Counsel waive request for PSI.  Counsel make sentencing statements.

BY THE COURT:
Court sentences defendant to serve 30 days in the Marquette County Jail, consecutive to any other sent  Granted 30 days credit.  Sentenced to time served.
*Pay costs of $518.00 within 60 days or set up a payment plan
*Submit DNA sample

Court advises defendant of postconviction relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Robert Johnson not in court.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared by video for Michael Robert Johnson. 
Court notes that zoom was set up with Wood County but he is not here today.
Atty Babiak states that sentencing is going to be done in Wood County today at 2:30pm; he has not received an offer from the DA's office as of yet.  Atty Babiak requests another status.
Atty Burdon states that the DA's office was waiting for the Wood County case to be done before an offer was made.
Atty Babiak does not object to a Prelim being set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim
State will prepare a writ
bond continued

1:11pm  Defendant now appears by video means.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
AMENDED:  from $1,000 Cash to $1,000 Signature bond  *No contact with Victim 1

3:21 PM Defendant Michael Robert Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak appeared by video for Michael Robert Johnson. 
Court notes that this is a motion to modify the cash bond.  Atty Babiak filed the motion to modify the cash to a signature bond due to his client sitting for almost a month now.  
Atty Juech is not objecting to a signature bond due to the defendant having a warrant out of Wood County that he needs to take care of.

BY THE COURT:  Motion is granted; Cash bond will be amended to a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions.
*No contact with Victim 1
Document labeled as Demand for Discovery/disclosure

10:06 AM Defendant Michael Robert Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jerome J Babiak in court for Michael Robert Johnson. 
Atty Babiak states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Babiak waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on April 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
